bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, November 17, 1952

div1.p: Hench regrets that he will be unable to attend the meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Association. However, he will report to the Association on the Camp Lazear dedication.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Albert G. Love, November 17, 1952
div1.opener:
November 17, 1952
General Albert G. Love
2709 Wisconsin Avenue N.W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear General Love:
div1.p:
I regret to say that once more I cannot come to
the meeting of the Walter Reed Memorial Associa-
tion. This distresses me because I am very happy
to be a member of this Association but, as you
know, I have been under considerable tension the
last two or three years with unusual demands.
However you are aware of my current activities
in behalf of Walter Reed and our Association
and I hope to fly to Cuba to be at the dedica-
tion of Camp Lazear on December 3. I will make
a report on this event to our Association.
Please give my kindest regards to our fellow
members.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
